bug.author: nhkrishna
bug.summary: Unit Test cases are failing on windows Platform
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h3>Description</denchmark-h>
Unit test executables (test_eltwise, test_lrn_forward, test_lrn_backward, test_lrn_backward, test_pooling_forward, test_pooling_backward, test_sum ), which are present at "\mkl-dnn-0.12\build\tests\gtests\Release" are failed to run in Windows platform. <denchmark-h:h3>Environment</denchmark-h>
PROCESSOR: Intel(R) Xeon(R) CPU E5-1650 v4 OS :Windows 10 Library version :Intel MKL_DNN v0.12 IDE: VS2015 Toolset: parallel_studio_xe_2017_update4_setup Compiler version :Intel(R) C++ Intel(R) 64 Compiler for applications running on Intel(R) 64, Version 17.0.4.210 Build 20170411 CMake version :3.10.2
<denchmark-h:h3>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
To build the library i have followed the below steps :
Downloaded the source code of the latest version(v0.12). Download mklml_win_2018.0.1.20171227.zip manually from GitHub release section and unpack it to the external directory in mkldnn root directory mkdir -p build and cd build cmake -G "Visual Studio 14 2015 Win64" -T"Intel C++ Compiler 17.0" .. In the build folder open the visual studio solution file and build it in release mode.(Use full optimization)
When i try to run the test_eltwise.exe from the windows command prompt , i've observed the below errors.
[==========] Running 185 tests from 6 test cases. [----------] Global test environment set-up. [----------] 45 tests from SimpleZeroNegativeSlope_NCHW/eltwise_test_float [ RUN ] SimpleZeroNegativeSlope_NCHW/eltwise_test_float.TestsEltwise/0 C:\Users\hnalla\Desktop\mlkdnn_new\mkl-dnn-0.12\tests\gtests\test_eltwise.cpp(167): error: The difference between dst_data[i] and ref_d is 0.75680249929428101, which exceeds 1.e-6, where dst_data[i] evaluates to -0.75680249929428101, ref_d evaluates to -0, and 1.e-6 evaluates to 9.9999999999999995e-07. comments.comment: Hi, This looks really strange... Do all the other tests pass (like convolutions, batch normalization, etc)? Did you try the latest master? Did you try to remove the build directory and rebuild whole MKL-DNN?
I have tried this , but still problem persists. Do you have any suggestion ?
No, the same tests are passing fine on Linux.

hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/emfomenk>@emfomenk</denchmark-link>
Is there any update on this ?

Unfortunately I cannot reproduce this issue on the systems I have access to... Let's focus on test_eltwise first. Could you please go to src/cpu/cpu_engine.cpp and manually comment out the following lines (optimized version of eltwise primitive): INSTANCE(jit_uni_eltwise_fwd_t<avx512_common>), INSTANCE(jit_uni_eltwise_bwd_t<avx512_common>), INSTANCE(jit_uni_eltwise_fwd_t<avx2>), INSTANCE(jit_uni_eltwise_bwd_t<avx2>), INSTANCE(jit_uni_eltwise_fwd_t<sse42>), INSTANCE(jit_uni_eltwise_bwd_t<sse42>), then recompile MKL-DNN and see whether test_eltwise still fails. If test passes un-comment sse42 part first and re-check. Then avx2 (your system supports exactly it). Please let me know the results. Another thing that might help us to figure out the bug is to finding the guilty commit. If you know that v0.10 works for you and v0.12 does not, you can bisect the commit that introduced the issue. That might take some time though...

Hi, Sorry for delay. The behavior you observe is super strange. There are two problems here:
eltwise_square and eltwise_abs tests fail due to exceptions thrown by MKL-DNN MKL-DNN computes relu w/ negative_slope != 0 incorrectly (how???!!!)
Frankly speaking, I have no idea why that happens... :( The only clue we have now is thrown exceptions. Could you please build MKL-DNN in DEBUG mode (pass -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=DEBUG to cmake) and run this gtest under debugger? Catch the exception and once caught, see the back-trace. Most likely you will see the problem in eltwise primitive descriptor creation. Please dump the descriptor that was given to the function. [paranoia mode on] Please double check that you don't have mkldnn.h/mkldnn.hpp/mkldnn_types.h header files from older mkl-dnn version (e.g. in system or in %INCLUDE% directories). The same for other mkldnn.dll that might be left from your older builds. [paranoia mode off]

hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/emfomenk>@emfomenk</denchmark-link> , thanks for your suggestion. Older version of mkldnn.dll left in my environment. Removing these paths resolved my issue. thanks
